meanings.definition: A wooden crosspiece that is fastened over the necks of two animals and attached to the plow or cart that they are to pull.
meanings.sent1: The farmer placed the yoke on the oxen before they started plowing the field.
meanings.sent2: The yoke helped the animals work together to pull the heavy load.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to wear the yoke, thinking it would help him carry acorns.
meanings.sent4: The yoke of responsibility weighed heavily on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The yoke creaked as the oxen pulled the plow through the field.

meanings.definition: A device for joining together a pair of draft animals, especially oxen, usually consisting of a crosspiece with two bow-shaped pieces, each enclosing the head of an animal.
meanings.sent1: The wooden yoke kept the oxen in line as they pulled the cart.
meanings.sent2: The farmer adjusted the yoke to fit the oxen comfortably.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat managed to slip out of the yoke and run free.
meanings.sent4: The yoke of tradition held the community together.
meanings.sent5: The sturdy yoke prevented the oxen from wandering off course.

meanings.sent1: The yoke of poverty was difficult to bear for the family.
meanings.sent2: The people fought against the yoke of tyranny.
meanings.sent3: The yoke of homework seemed never-ending to the students.
meanings.sent4: She felt the heavy yoke of guilt weighing on her conscience.
meanings.sent5: Breaking free from the yoke of fear allowed him to pursue his dreams.
